executive_summary: Demand for ophthalmic instruments has grown over recent years. As the population of the United States ages, the number of consumers suffering from eye conditions will rise. Older individuals are more susceptible to developing macular degeneration, cataracts, glaucoma and diabetic retinal disease. Thus, demand for ophthalmology procedures rises as the domestic population ages, boosting ophthalmic instrument sales.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: An Aging Population is Likely to Support Demand for Producers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As consumers age, they become more susceptible to eye diseases, including macular degeneration, diabetic-related retinal disease, cataracts and glaucoma. The progressive aging of the US population has driven demand for contact lenses and other ophthalmic products. These age-related problems have spurred an increase in eye surgeries, and demand for diagnostic and surgical ophthalmic equipment has grown accordingly.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Trade Activity Impacts Demand for Domestic Manufacturers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Imported ophthalmic instruments pose a significant threat to the industry as, depending on the product, buyers are more inclined to purchase the more affordable option. This trend is less prominent with specialized equipment used for surgery. However, many large producers have opened manufacturing facilities throughout Europe, aiming to establish a footprint in countries that can support high-tech manufacturing and provide an adequate supply of skilled labor.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Pandemic Directly Impacted Industry Performance
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the 2020 pandemic, demand for non-COVID-19 related health conditions weakened, as both consumers and doctors avoided non-essential procedures to limit the spread of the virus. This trend mainly harmed smaller producers that work with local health practices.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Increased Public and Private Health Spending
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) increased public and private health spending on health programs. In 2017, the requirement for individuals to purchase some form of health insurance was repealed, causing revenue to weaken. However, during the 2020 pandemic, the federal and state governments diverted more funds into healthcare to assist with the pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: POPULATION TRENDS WILL CONTINUE TO BOOST DEMAND FOR OPHTHALMIC INSTRUMENTS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The falling number of births, combined with aging generations, such as Baby Boomers, Gen X and Millenials, will cause older consumers to make up a great portion of the market. An aging population will boost demand for vision services for common refractive disorders, such as astigmatism, nearsightedness and farsightedness, with many opting to undergo LASIK surgery to rectify these conditions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MANUFACTURERS WILL CONTINUE BEING IMPACTED BY VARIOUS TRENDS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consolidation activity will likely remain a common practice over the coming years as the largest ophthalmic instrument manufacturers continue purchasing emerging competitors to gain market share.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Domestic producers are expected to benefit
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Domestic producers are expected to benefit from the estimated devaluation of the US dollar, as it will make US-produced instruments comparatively more affordable both domestically and overseas. However, competition will likely remain intense as more producers continue establishing manufacturing facilities across Europe.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Technological Developments Are Likely To Drive Revenue Growth
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Eyecare technology will continue to evolve over the coming years. A new technique gaining popularity is the use of femtosecond lasers for refractive cataract surgery, a procedure that is customized to a patient's eye features, reducing surgery time and making the recovery process more manageable. With this new technique, many aspects of cataract surgery, which were once done by hand, can be performed with computer-guided lasers, greatly improving surgical precision and accuracy.

industry_definition: This industry manufactures ophthalmic diagnostic instruments and surgical equipment used in eye-related medical procedures. Examples of diagnostic equipment include optical coherence tomography scanners, ophthalmic ultrasound systems, cameras, scopes, tonometers and lighting equipment. Examples of surgical equipment include ophthalmic lasers, as well as cataract, glaucoma, refractive and other surgery devices.

key_trends: The aging population supports demand for producers. Individuals over the age of 40 are susceptible to eye-related conditions, boosting ophthalmic equipment sales.

The expected depreciation of the dollar is likely to benefit domestic producers. A weaker dollar makes domestic products more affordable in both the US and foreign markets, which is likely to boost sales.
Multiple agencies regulate medical instrument producers, leading to strict quality standards and requirements that aim to ensure the safety of the patient.

An aging population will continue to drive revenue growth. Older consumers generate higher demand for healthcare services; as the population continues to age, demand for ophthalmic procedures is likely to continue growing.

Diagnostic equipment is a crucial tool for medical professionals. However, little technological innovation and standardized products have made these products vulnerable to being replaced by more affordable imports.

Primary eyecare doctors and specialist ophthalmologists are key for the industry. While primary eyecare doctors tend to lean more towards affordable equipment, specialists invest in high-end, cutting-edge equipment.

Highly populated regions attract more manufacturers. The geographic proximity to major buyers enables producers to establish strong relationships with buyers and lower transportation costs. California holds the largest portion of manufacturers. San Francisco, particularly Silicon Valley, is considered a biomedical hub, attracting ophthalmic instrument manufacturers.

The industry prioritizes technology and product range over price competition. Manufacturers invest in research and development to introduce innovative products or enhance existing ones to capture a larger market share.
Manufacturers compete with foreign producers. This trend has grown over recent years, as an appreciating US dollar leads to rising demand for imported products.
Major manufacturers acquire smaller producers. This is a common trend across the industry, as companies like Alcon aim to expand their product range.
Bausch Health Companies goes public, enabling the company to raise capital for new product development and enhanced operations.
Input price volatility led to higher purchase costs. Supply chain disruptions and higher demand for inputs caused purchase costs to rise, harming profit.

Manufacturers rely heavily on skilled employees. Demand for medical instruments is driven by technological development, forcing producers to invest in workers with the necessary skill set to develop new products.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Primary eyecare doctors include optometrists and primary care ophthalmologists that focus on diagnoses and noninvasive treatment of eye-related illnesses.
Specialist ophthalmologists include ophthalmological surgeons, as well as doctors that specialize in the treatment of a particular syndrome, such as glaucoma or cataracts.

products_and_services.product_description: Diagnostic equipment includes multiple devices that enable medical professionals to accurately diagnose their patients.

Laser technology can be used in ophthalmic surgery in lieu of traditional surgical procedures.

regulations_points.regulation_description: New medical instruments and supplies manufactured within this industry classify as Class III medical devices.
When a manufacturer wants clearance for a device that they are seeking to market, they must submit a premarket notification to the FDA.
A PMA application must be submitted if the device cannot be cleared through the 510(k) premarket notification procedures.

FAQs.question: How do rising imports from abroad impact your company?
FAQs.answer: There is strong overseas demand for ophthalmic goods, making this industry a net exporter.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or produce a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Most companies in this industry also produce other medical devices and supplies.
